intro: Tambourissa madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar tambourissa, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of the island. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough texture, while its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
